title: Reimagining healthcare from the ground up: Meet the 15 trailblazing startups of I-HEAL @ ISB 3.0 cohort
summary: The Indian School of Business (ISB) announces its third cohort of healthcare startups under the I-HEAL program, featuring 15 innovative companies working to transform healthcare delivery and accessibility in India.
content:
The Indian School of Business (ISB) has unveiled the latest batch of healthcare startups selected for its I-HEAL healthcare accelerator program. Now in its third iteration, I-HEAL @ ISB 3.0 welcomes 15 promising startups that are leveraging technology and innovation to address critical challenges in India's healthcare sector.

These startups span various healthcare domains including telemedicine, medical devices, healthcare delivery, and digital health solutions. The selected companies will receive mentorship, networking opportunities, and strategic guidance to scale their solutions.

The program aims to foster innovation in healthcare while making quality medical care more accessible and affordable across India. Selected startups will work closely with industry experts, healthcare professionals, and business leaders during the acceleration period.

source.title: Reimagining healthcare from the ground up: Meet the 15 trailblazing startups of I‑HEAL @ ISB 3.0 cohort

markdown_content:
## Program Announcement
The Indian School of Business (ISB) has unveiled the latest batch of healthcare startups selected for its I-HEAL healthcare accelerator program. Now in its third iteration, I-HEAL @ ISB 3.0 welcomes 15 promising startups that are leveraging technology and innovation to address critical challenges in India's healthcare sector.

## Focus Areas
These startups span various healthcare domains including:
* Telemedicine
* Medical devices
* Healthcare delivery
* Digital health solutions

The selected companies will receive mentorship, networking opportunities, and strategic guidance to scale their solutions.

## Program Objectives
The program aims to foster innovation in healthcare while making quality medical care more accessible and affordable across India. Selected startups will work closely with industry experts, healthcare professionals, and business leaders during the acceleration period.
